awd_titl_txt: Astronomical Studies with the Caltech Submillimeter         Observatory
awd_abstract_narration: The California Institute of Technology Submillimeter Observatory                (CSO) consists of the first large telescope designed specifically               for submillimeter wavelength astronomy.  It is the only U.S.                    supported submillimeter-wave telescope.  With excellent                         sensitivity for both continuum and spectroscopic observations and               with angular resolutions between 30 and 8 seconds of arc,                       innovative projects can be undertaken to provide critical new                   information in many fields of astronomy, including studies of the               Solar System, our Galaxy, and extragalactic phenomena.                                                                                                          This grant will support a multifaceted scientific research and                  technology development program focussed on the 10.4 meter                       diameter telescope of the CSO.  The telescope is sited at an                    altitude of 4100 meters on Mauna Kea, Hawaii, where the                         atmosphere is very dry and ideal for observations at wavelengths                as short as 320 microns.  During the grant period, receivers                    should become available for observations over the wavelength                    range of 1 mm to 350 microns.  One half of the observing time is                available for use by the national astronomy community.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
